AVSEC Circular No. 05/2016
Subject:
Change
in Designation
of Appropriate
Authority
-
Bureau
of Civil Aviation
Security.
In pursuance of Sub-section (1) of Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 1934 (22 of 1934), the
Central Government hereby empowers the Commissioner of Security, Civil Aviation, Bureau of
Civil Aviation Security to issue order, directions relate to safeguarding the Civil Aviation from
time to time. The Commissioner
of Security (CA) is the Appropriate Authority for development,
implementation
and maintenance
of National Civil Aviation Security Programme of India vide
Ministry
of Civil Aviation
& Tourism
Notification
dated 2711011998 under reference
No.
AV.13024/4/98-SSV.
2.
Now, in pursuance of Ministry of Civil Aviation Order dated 04/02/2016 the Commissioner
of Security (CA) has been re-designated as Director General, Bureau of Civil Aviation Security.
3.
All reference to "Commissioner
of Security Civil Aviation" in all documents may now be
read as "Director General, Bureau of Civil Aviation Security".
4.
Hereinafter,
all communications/correspondences
will now be addressed
as per the
following:
Director General
Bureau of Civil Aviation Security Ministry
of Civil Aviation
Government of India
Janpath Bhawan, "A" - Wing, I-III Floor
Janpath, New Delhi - 110001.
5.
All concerned are requested to update their records accordingly.
